alert.note: Alert for Arthur; Keith; Lincoln; McPherson (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 1:06AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Arthur, northern Keith, northwestern Lincoln and southwestern McPherson Counties through 145 AM CDT/1245 AM MDT/... At 106 AM CDT/1206 AM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lemoyne, or 7 miles north of Ogallala, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ogallala, Lemoyne, Keystone, Kingsley Dam, Big Bald Hill, Bucktail Lake, Flatts, Big Lamunyon Flats, Diamond Bar Lake, Broganville, Schnick Lake and Lake View Campground. This includes the following highways... Highway 61 between mile markers 89 and 109. Highway 92 between mile markers 128 and 138, and between mile markers 181 and 194. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT/200 AM MDT/ for southwestern Nebraska...and southwestern and west central Nebraska.
